p: Attempts to reduce water consumption also show small effects ( d = −0.052 95% CI −0.079, −0.025). This category includes a subset of papers examining how to reduce the use of multiple towels by hotel guests. This subset of papers reports the highest effect sizes ( d = −0.168 95% CI −0.271, −0.064) within this category with a POB of 11.9%. Removing these papers and analysing the impact of interventions specifically to reduce daily water use in households decreases the effect size to d = −0.028 (95% CI −0.046, −0.010) statistically homogeneous ( I 2 = 19.5% ns). This corresponds to a POB of 2%.
